title: EDD garnishing wages.
question: My husband has recently been getting his checks garnished from EDD. He called and asked them if they could lower the monthly payments, instead of the 25% they are taking. they told him too bad. Is there anything he can do to lower this outrageous amount he is being forced to pay? Thank you!
answers: With two answers, which do you choose? You choose the answer from the in state attorney. If you cannot exempt the money, then you are subject to the limits of state law (and 25% is usually state law).
He can file a claim of exemption with the court. He should go to the court self help center so that they can show him how to do this.
A motion to quash garnishment might lie: you will need an atty.

Claim of exemption. You do not necessarily need an attorney for this work - the forms can be found online, including instructions. Look here for resources & tools for managing this from the California courts: http://www.courts.ca.gov/11418.htm

Remember, however, that while a successful claim of exemption may reduce or stop entirely your wages from being garnished, the underlying claim or debt does not "go away".

Best of luck
